io.straas.android.sdk.circall

Class CircallManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.straas.android.sdk.circall.CircallManager

  • public class CircallManager
extends Object
    CircallManager is used to manage a Straas CirCall client. To construct a CircallManager, you have to call initialize() to get your result. These methods will check your developer credential, if it passed, you will get a CircallManager. Then, you can use methods in CircallManager to start live circall.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  CircallManager.CircallState
      Show state of CircallManager, including STATE_IDLE, STATE_PREPARING, STATE_PREPARED, STATE_CONNECTING, STATE_CONNECTED and STATE_DISCONNECTING,

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int STATE_CONNECTED
      State indicating this CirCall client is currently connected.
      static int STATE_CONNECTING
      The state CircallManager is currently connecting to a CirCall room.
      static int STATE_DISCONNECTING
      The state CircallManager is trying to disconnect from a CirCall room.
      static int STATE_IDLE
      The initial state or the state after destroy()
      static int STATE_PREPARED
      The state after prepareForCameraCapture(android.content.Context, io.straas.android.sdk.circall.CircallConfig) or prepareForUrl(android.content.Context) finishes successfully.
      static int STATE_PREPARING
      The state CircallManager is trying to prepare local media.

        The state CircallManager is trying to prepare local media.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_PREPARED

        public static final int STATE_PREPARED
        The state after prepareForCameraCapture(android.content.Context, io.straas.android.sdk.circall.CircallConfig) or prepareForUrl(android.content.Context) finishes successfully. You can try to connect to CirCall by invoking connect(io.straas.android.sdk.circall.CircallToken) in this state.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_CONNECTING

        public static final int STATE_CONNECTING
        The state CircallManager is currently connecting to a CirCall room.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final int STATE_CONNECTED
        State indicating this CirCall client is currently connected.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_DISCONNECTING

        public static final int STATE_DISCONNECTING
        The state CircallManager is trying to disconnect from a CirCall room.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<CircallManager> initialize()
        Constructs a CircallManager if you are a authorized developer.
        Returns:
        You could get a CircallManager by the Task if task succeeded.

      • prepareForCameraCapture

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<CircallStream> prepareForCameraCapture(Context context,
                                                                                CircallConfig config)
        Initializes camera, codec, and microphone. After this task succeeds, you will get a CircallStream. Then, you can use CircallPlayerView.setCircallStream(CircallStream) to preview your video from camera.

        This method should only be called when the CircallManager status is STATE_IDLE or STATE_PREPARED.
        Parameters:
        config - provides information of stream
        Returns:
        You could get a CircallStream by the Task if task succeeded.
        See Also:
        CircallPlayerView.setCircallStream(CircallStream), publishWithCameraCapture(CircallPublishConfig)

      • prepareForUrl

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> prepareForUrl(Context context)
        Initializes for publishWithUrl(CircallPublishWithUrlConfig).

        This method should only be called when the CircallManager status is STATE_IDLE or STATE_PREPARED.
        Returns:
        You could get a CircallStream by the Task if task succeeded.
        See Also:
        h

      • connect

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> connect(@NonNull
                                                       CircallToken token)
        Establishes a connection to the CirCall room.

        This method should only be called when the CircallManager status is STATE_PREPARED.
        Parameters:
        token - Any task of the CircallManager you get will be executed by this CircallToken.
        Returns:
        You could get the result by this Task.

      • publishWithCameraCapture

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> publishWithCameraCapture(CircallPublishConfig config)
        Publishes the camera captured stream.

        This method should only be called when the CircallManager status is STATE_CONNECTED.
        Parameters:
        config - provides the configuration for publish stream, see CircallPublishConfig
        Returns:
        You could get the result by this Task.
        See Also:
        #prepareForCameraCapture(CircallConfig, CircallPlayerView, CircallPlayConfig)

      • publishWithUrl

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> publishWithUrl(CircallPublishWithUrlConfig config)
        Publishes the stream from the url(RTSP) to the room, so other people can subscribe this stream in a room they joined.

        This method should only be called when the CircallManager status is STATE_CONNECTED.
        Parameters:
        config - provides the configuration for publishing stream
        Returns:
        You could get the result by this Task.
        See Also:
        prepareForUrl(Context)

        This method should only be called when the CircallManager status is STATE_CONNECTED.
        Returns:
        You could get the result by this Task.

      • startRecording

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<String> startRecording(CircallStream stream)
        Start recording of the target stream. Streams are recorded on the server side.

        This method should only be called when the CircallManager status is STATE_CONNECTED.
        Parameters:
        stream - the target stream, see CircallStream
        Returns:
        You could get a recording id associated with this target stream by the Task if task succeeded.

      • stopRecording

        Stop recording of the target stream.

        This method should only be called when the CircallManager status is STATE_CONNECTED.
        Parameters:
        stream - the target stream, see CircallStream
        recordingId - the target recording id, see startRecording(io.straas.android.sdk.circall.CircallStream)
        Returns:
        You could get the result by this Task.

      • removeAllEventListener

        public void removeAllEventListener()
        Remove all event listener, no one could receive future event. See EventListener.

      • disconnect

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> disconnect()
        Stops the operation doing in connect(io.straas.android.sdk.circall.CircallToken), that is connecting and circall. This method should only be called when the CircallManager status is STATE_CONNECTING or STATE_CONNECTED.
        Returns:
        You could get the result by this Task.

      • destroy

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> destroy()
        Destroy CircallManager. This method will do operation in disconnect() and release resources generated at prepareForCameraCapture(android.content.Context, io.straas.android.sdk.circall.CircallConfig) or prepareForUrl(android.content.Context). This method shouldn't be called when the CircallManager status is STATE_IDLE.
        Returns:
        You could get the result by this Task.

      • getCircallState

        public int getCircallState()
        Get the current CircallManager state.
        Returns:
        CircallManager.CircallState

      • isStreamPublished

        public boolean isStreamPublished()
        Whether the local stream is published or not.
        Returns:
        true if the local stream is published

      • getRemoteStreams

        public List<CircallStream> getRemoteStreams()
        Gets the remote streams in this room, but not guarantee the streams order.
        Returns:
        CircallStream
